revised_title: Harry Jones: A Theoretical Physicist and His Contributions to the Study of Metals
tldr: Harry Jones was a theoretical physicist who made significant contributions to the study of electrons in metals and the understanding of explosions. He worked at Imperial College, where he presided over the postwar expansion of the mathematics department. Jones studied the behavior of electrons in metals using quantum mechanics and made important discoveries about the properties of metals and alloys. His work had a significant impact on the field of solid-state physics.
